/data/readings.description: Readings for one or more measure time series.

get.description: Readings for one or more measure time series.

parameters.name: completeness
parameters.description: Whether the data for this reading is complete or not

parameters.name: dateTime
parameters.description: The date and time of the reading

parameters.name: measure
parameters.description: The measure timeseries containing this reading

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The reading value in units defined by the timeseries, may be missing if data quality is 'Missing'

parameters.name: completeness
parameters.description: Whether the data for this reading is complete or not

parameters.name: dateTime
parameters.description: The date and time of the reading

parameters.name: invalid
parameters.description: Percentage of data points for aggregate value (e.g. daily mean) which were invalid

parameters.name: measure
parameters.description: The measure timeseries containing this reading

parameters.name: missing
parameters.description: Percentage of data points for aggregate value (e.g. daily mean) which were missing

parameters.name: valid
parameters.description: Percentage of data points for aggregate value (e.g. daily mean) which were valid

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The reading value in units defined by the timeseries, may be missing if data quality is 'Missing'

/id/measures.description: List of all available measurement timeseries in the hydrology dataset.

get.description: List of all available measurement timeseries in the hydrology dataset.

parameters.name: datumType
parameters.description: For level measurements this indicates the type of reference point the level is measured from. Can be relative to the Ordnance Survey datum (rt:AOD), to a local stage datum (rt:ASD) or rt:BDAT (below datum?).

parameters.name: notation
parameters.description: A string or other literal which uniquely identifies the item.

parameters.name: observationType
parameters.description: Indicates the nature of the observations in a dataset, for example raw measured v.s. quality controlled

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.description: Short, cannonical, name of the quantity being measured e.g. "level", "flow" or "temperature".

parameters.name: parameterName
parameters.description: The name of the quantity being measured e.g. "Water Level", "Flow", "Temperature"

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: The period between successive readings, in seconds.

parameters.name: qualifier
parameters.description: A qualilfier for the quantity being measured. Most common use is to separate level measures which occur at the top ("Stage") or bottom ("Downstream Stage") of a sluice or weir. Other relevant qualifiers are "Tidal Level" and "Groundwater".

parameters.name: station
parameters.description: The URI of the monitoring station supplying the measure

parameters.name: station.RLOIid
parameters.description: Identifier for the station, as used by River Levels On the Internet.

parameters.name: station.stationReference
parameters.description: Identifier for the telemetry feed used by the Environment Agency's National Flood Forecasting System

parameters.name: station.wiskiID
parameters.description: Identifier for the station in the WISKI hydrology dataset

parameters.name: unit
parameters.description: The units in which this parameter is measured, e.g. qudt:Meter

parameters.name: unitName
parameters.description: A  name for the units for this measurement including the datumType. Typical values are mAOD (for meters relative to the Ordnance Survey datum), mASD (for meters relative to the local stage datum), m (for meters with an unspecified datum) and m3/s (for flow rates).

parameters.name: valueStatistic
parameters.description: Indicates whether the values in a time series represent mean, min, max, instananteous or other statistics over the measurement interval.

/id/stations.description: List of all monitoring stations can be filtered by name, location and other parameters.

get.description: List of all monitoring stations can be filtered by name, location and other parameters.

parameters.name: RLOIid
parameters.description: Identifier for the station, as used by River Levels On the Internet.

parameters.name: catchmentName
parameters.description: The name of the river catchment which this site is related to, if any

parameters.name: dateOpened
parameters.description: The date on which the station opened

parameters.name: datum
parameters.description: The datum level for the measurement point on OS datum

parameters.name: measures
parameters.description: The set of measurement types available from the station

parameters.name: measures.notation
parameters.description: A string or other literal which uniquely identifies the item.

parameters.name: measures.observationType
parameters.description: Indicates the nature of the observations in a dataset, for example raw measured v.s. quality controlled

parameters.name: measures.period
parameters.description: The period between successive readings, in seconds.

parameters.name: measures.qualifier
parameters.description: A qualilfier for the quantity being measured. Most common use is to separate level measures which occur at the top ("Stage") or bottom ("Downstream Stage") of a sluice or weir. Other relevant qualifiers are "Tidal Level" and "Groundwater".

parameters.name: measures.unitName
parameters.description: A  name for the units for this measurement including the datumType. Typical values are mAOD (for meters relative to the Ordnance Survey datum), mASD (for meters relative to the local stage datum), m (for meters with an unspecified datum) and m3/s (for flow rates).

parameters.name: measures.valueStatistic
parameters.description: Indicates whether the values in a time series represent mean, min, max, instananteous or other statistics over the measurement interval.

parameters.name: notation
parameters.description: A string or other literal which uniquely identifies the item.

parameters.name: nrfaStationID
parameters.description: ID of corresponding station in NRFA

parameters.name: nrfaStationURL
parameters.description: URL for corresponding station in NRFA

parameters.name: riverName
parameters.description: Name of river associated with this monitoring station (when available)

parameters.name: sampleOf
parameters.description: A larger feature which sampling point measures, samples or represents

parameters.name: stationReference
parameters.description: Identifier for the telemetry feed used by the Environment Agency's National Flood Forecasting System

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Indicates whether a station is active, suspended or closed

parameters.name: town
parameters.description: Name of the nearest town (or named place) to the station

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The class, or classes, of this item

parameters.name: wiskiID
parameters.description: Identifier for the station in the WISKI hydrology dataset

search.name: search
search.description: Will filter the list for only those whose label or comment fields contain a matching word. The search keywords will be filtered to remove punctuation characters meaningful to the underlying search engine, so only plain alphanumeric keywords can be reliably used as search terms.

with-geometry.name: with-geometry
with-geometry.description: Adds a GeoJSON geometry to the list of returned properties. Not required with a GeoJSON request.

easting.name: easting
easting.description: Should be used in combination with "northing" and "dist": easting={x}&northing={y}&dist={d}

_limit.name: _limit
_limit.description: Return only a given number of items from the list, some endpoints may impose a default limit and/or a maximum to which the limit can be set. In particular, sampling points, samples and measurements default to a soft limit of 50 items but that can be overridden.

_offset.name: _offset
_offset.description: Return the list of items starting with the xth item, together with _limit this enables paging through a long set of results. Though it often cheaper to simply return all that you want in one go or to use filters to reduce the list to a subset of interest.

dist.name: dist
dist.description: Should be used in combination with "lat" and "long": lat={x}&long={y}&dist={d}, or "easting" and "northing": easting={x}&northing={y}&dist={d}

northing.name: northing
northing.description: Should be used in combination with "easting" and "dist": easting={x}&northing={y}&dist={d}

_sort.name: _sort
_sort.description: Reorder the list of returned results by the value of the named property of the results. Use -{property} to sort in descending instead of ascending order. Multiple sort parameters can be given.

_projection.name: _projection
_projection.description: Lets you return a subset of properties that are specified by the endpoint view. All the properties returned by an endpoint are defined in the model below.

long.name: long
long.description: Should be used in combination with "lat" and "dist": lat={x}&long={y}&dist={d}

lat.name: lat
lat.description: Should be used in combination with "long" and "dist": lat={x}&long={y}&dist={d}
